comments:
Eclipse 2.0 (2002-05-21, F1)

Steps to reproduce:

1.  Create a scrapbook page.
2.  Type in scrapbook page:  new Vector()
3.  Highlight text in scrapbook page.
4.  Select "Inspect" from the editor's context menu.
5.  The Debug Perspective will open and the following error will be displayed:

"Evaluation failed: internal error - unable to obtain an execution context."


The workspace's .metadata/.log file will contain the following error:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 120 May 23, 2002 22:45:50.480
!MESSAGE Internal error logged from JDI Debug: 
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java:127)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java:137)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:168)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:186)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ClassTypeImpl.newInstance
(ClassTypeImpl.java:294)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget$ThreadTerminator.handle
Event(JDIDebugTarget.java:1645)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch
(EventDispatcher.java:129)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run
(EventDispatcher.java:202)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

What runtime/platform are you on? (i.e. what is the JRE for your scrapbook 
page - it can be the system default, or explicitly specified in scrapbook 
properties. If you are using the default, what is your workspace default JRE?).

I'm using the default JRE for both the workspace and the scrapbook page, which 
is Sun's JDK 1.3.

Which version of 1.3? (i.e. 1.3.1_01, 1.3.0???). There were bugs in 1.3.0 that 
could effect scrapbook launching. Turn off the java debug preference 
to "Suspend on uncaught exception" to see if this fixes the problem.

C:\jdk1.3\bin>java -version
java version "1.3.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.0-C)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.0-C, mixed mode)

Problem with Sun 1.3.0. If you turn off the "suspend on uncaught exception" 
preference this works. Otherwise you have to manually resume the VM and do the 
expression eval again.

Not a problem with newer VMs
